Community Health Centers are the backbone of care for vulnerable communities, serving hundreds of thousands of people in the 9th District. Read my op-ed in the @fwmirror on the need for Congress to act before Sept. 30 to support health centers. #ValueCHCs. http://www.federalwaymirror.com/opinion/congress-cant-leave-community-health-centers-and-patients-behind/ …

Cutting U.S. foreign aid has devastating consequences for communities in need and harms America’s security. I echo the concerns from my colleagues and urge the Administration to listen to the bipartisan opposition to their plan from Congress.

The Administration’s proposed rescission package for foreign aid is reckless and dangerous. Congress appropriated this money for a reason – the same reason military officials consistently urge investments in development and diplomacy – it makes America safer. https://twitter.com/USGLC/status/1162451034624667653 …

Community health centers provide vital services to the most vulnerable in our communities. I want to thank @HealthPointCHC for the work they do and call on my colleagues to support legislation to increase funding for these health centers. https://twitter.com/HealthPointCHC/status/1160708692582502400 …

America will always standby the Statue of Liberty’s promise, “Give me your tired, your poor, Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, The wretched refuse of your teeming shore. Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me, I lift my lamp beside the golden door!”

The Trump Administration’s bigoted revised version of the Statue of Liberty's poem to reflect their new public charge rule doesn’t represent American values or the dignity with which we should treat immigrants. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1161265286898683904 …

This weekend, we witnessed 2 mass shootings in 2 American cities in the span of 24 hours. My heart is with the people of El Paso and Dayton—but that is not enough. We must act. I call on @senatemajldr to bring the Bipartisan Background Checks Act to the floor. #EnoughIsEnough
